verses.verse: When you go forth<WH3318> to battle<WH4421> against your enemies,<WH341> and see<WH7200> horses,<WH5483> chariots,<WH7393> and a people<WH5971> more<WH7227> than you,<WH3372> you shall not be afraid of them;<WH3068> for Yahweh your God<WH430> is with you,<WH5927> who brought you up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
It shall be,<WH7126> when you draw near to the battle,<WH4421> that the priest<WH3548> shall approach<WH5066> and speak<WH1696> to the people,<WH5971>

and shall tell<WH559> them,<WH8085> "Hear, Israel,<WH3478> you draw near<WH7131> this day<WH3117> to battle<WH4421> against your enemies:<WH341> don't<WH3824> let your heart faint;<WH7401> don't<WH3372> be afraid, nor tremble,<WH2648> neither be scared<WH6206> of them;<WH6440>
for Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> is he who goes<WH1980> with you,<WH3898> to fight for you against your enemies,<WH341> to save you.<WH3467>"

The officers<WH7860> shall speak<WH1696> to the people,<WH5971> saying,<WH559> "What man<WH376> is there who has built<WH1129> a new<WH2319> house,<WH1004> and has not dedicated<WH2596> it?<WH3212> Let him go and return<WH7725> to his house,<WH1004> lest he die<WH4191> in the battle,<WH4421> and another<WH312> man<WH376> dedicate it.<WH2596>

What man<WH376> is there who has planted<WH5193> a vineyard,<WH3754> and has not used<WH2490> its fruit?<WH3212> Let him go and return<WH7725> to his house,<WH1004> lest he die<WH4191> in the battle,<WH4421> and another<WH312> man<WH376> use its fruit.<WH2490>

What man<WH376> is there who has pledged to be married<WH781> a wife,<WH802> and has not taken<WH3947> her?<WH3212> Let him go and return<WH7725> to his house,<WH1004> lest he die<WH4191> in the battle,<WH4421> and another<WH312> man<WH376> take her.<WH3947>"

The officers<WH7860> shall speak<WH1696> further<WH3254> to the people,<WH5971> and they shall say,<WH559> "What man<WH376> is there who is fearful<WH3373> and fainthearted?<WH7390> Let him go<WH3212> and return<WH7725> to his house,<WH1004> lest his brother<WH251>'s heart<WH3824> melt<WH4549> as his heart.<WH3824>"

It shall be,<WH7860> when the officers have made an end<WH3615> of speaking<WH1696> to the people,<WH5971> that they shall appoint<WH6485> captains<WH8269> of armies<WH6635> at the head<WH7218> of the people.<WH5971>
When you draw near<WH7126> to a city<WH5892> to fight<WH3898> against it,<WH7121> then proclaim peace to it.<WH7965>

It shall be,<WH6030> if it makes you answer of peace,<WH7965> and opens<WH6605> to you,<WH5971> then it shall be, that all the people who are found<WH4672> therein shall become tributary<WH4522> to you,<WH5647> and shall serve you.
If it will make no peace<WH7999> with you,<WH6213> but will make war<WH4421> against you,<WH6696> then you shall besiege it:
and when Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> delivers<WH5414> it into your hand,<WH3027> you shall strike<WH5221> every male<WH2138> of it with the edge<WH6310> of the sword:<WH2719>

but the women,<WH802> and the little ones,<WH2945> and the livestock,<WH929> and all that is in the city,<WH5892> even all its spoil,<WH7998> you shall take<WH962> for a prey to yourself;<WH398> and you shall eat the spoil<WH7998> of your enemies,<WH341> which Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> has given you.<WH5414>
Thus you shall do<WH6213> to all the cities<WH5892> which are very<WH3966> far off<WH7350> from you,<WH2007> which are not of the cities<WH5892> of these nations.<WH1471>
But of the cities<WH5892> of these peoples,<WH5971> that Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> gives<WH5414> you for an inheritance,<WH5159> you shall save alive<WH2421> nothing that breathes;<WH5397>

but you shall utterly<WH2763> destroy<WH2763> them:<WH2850> the Hittite, and the Amorite,<WH567> the Canaanite,<WH3669> and the Perizzite,<WH6522> the Hivite,<WH2340> and the Jebusite;<WH2983> as Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> has commanded you;<WH6680>
that they not teach<WH3925> you to do<WH6213> after all their abominations,<WH8441> which they have done<WH6213> to their gods;<WH430> so would you sin<WH2398> against Yahweh<WH3068> your God.<WH430>

When you shall besiege<WH6696> a city<WH5892> a long<WH7227> time,<WH3117> in making war<WH3898> against it to take<WH8610> it,<WH7843> you shall not destroy its trees<WH6086> by wielding<WH5080> an axe<WH1631> against them;<WH398> for you may eat of them,<WH3772> and you shall not cut them down; for is the tree<WH6086> of the field<WH7704> man,<WH120> that it should<WH935> be besieged of you?<WH6440>

Only the trees<WH6086> of which you know<WH3045> that they are not trees<WH6086> for food,<WH3978> you shall destroy<WH7843> and cut them down;<WH3772> and you shall build<WH1129> bulwarks<WH4692> against the city<WH5892> that makes<WH6213> war<WH4421> with you,<WH3381> until it fall.
